text.title: I ignore the spotlight as a staff engineer | Hacker News
text.text: I ignore the spotlight as a staff engineer | Hacker News Hacker News new | past | comments | ask | show | jobs | submit login I ignore the spotlight as a staff engineer ( lalitm.com ) 52 points by todsacerdoti 1 hour ago | hide | past | favorite | 5 comments zdragnar 7 minutes ago | next [–] That's the dream at a big company for sure. The last mega tech company I worked for had the familiar trap of not knowing how to rate higher level engineers. Things basically turned into a popularity contest, with grading criteria like your "impact on or leadership in the tech community" and other such nonsense. Quietly making good things and enabling good people to be better is where it is at. reply beernet 8 minutes ago | prev | next [–] >> instead of execs telling us “you should do X”, we figure out what we think will have the most impact to our customers and work on building those features and tools What could possibly go wrong here? reply sd9 3 minutes ago | parent | next [–] What do you mean? The quoted text is the strategy I always use. I don't want or need to be told top down what to do, it's better to think for myself and propose that upward. Execs appreciate it because it makes their job easier; users get the features they actually want. What am I missing that makes this a bad strategy? reply 0x696C6961 5 minutes ago | parent | prev | next [–] The same things that go wrong anyway? reply chrisweekly 14 minutes ago | prev [–] Beautifully-written post, full of insights. Thanks for sharing! reply Guidelines | FAQ | Lists | API | Security | Legal | Apply to YC | Contact Search:
